byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Kabul, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Fahim Abed and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: American and Afghan officials warn security crisis in Afghanistan is empowering extremist groups like Islamic State and Al Qaeda, which have claimed large portions of territory from government despite presence of 10,000 American troops; remains to be seen how Pres-elect Donald Trump will handle deteriorating situation he is set to inherit.

headline.print_headline: Security Crisis in Afghanistan Sets the Stage for Terrorist Groups’ Resurgence
headline.main: Afghan Security Crisis Sets Stage for Terrorists’ Resurgence

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: As the Taliban retake large chunks of territory, they are creating an ungoverned breeding ground for several militant extremist groups....
lead_paragraph: As the Taliban retake large chunks of territory, they are creating an ungoverned breeding ground for several militant extremist groups.
